content: 1 that s meshed up top reminiscent of the string vests my granny made back in the 80s here is my take on a classic mesh top it is made to measure top down with raglan sleeves it can be long or short sleeved and can be made to be fitted or oversized this pattern is quick and fun to make and is suitable for beginners designed by vikki bruff instagram @vee_bee_x all rights reserved copyright victoria bruff 2024 this pattern may not be reproduced in any form either manually or electronically that s meshed up top copyright victoria bruff 2024 2 skill level beginner yarn used paintbox cotton dk 4 balls in black to make the long-sleeved top uk 12/14 hooks used 4 5 mm other supplies 4 stitch markers darning needle allow extra balls of yarn for larger sizes approx 50g per size gauge sizing any as it is made to measure adjusted to fit made to measure hints and tips pattern is written in uk terms keep measuring and trying on to ensure a perfect fit this pattern is worked in the round do not turn your work at the end of the round abbreviations beg beginning chain chain chain-space chain space chain- refers to chain made previously e g chain-3 double_crochet double_crochet dtr double treble_crochet sm stitch marker that s meshed up top copyright victoria bruff 2024 3 abbreviations in next sts to be worked into same stitch space space pm place marker slip_stitch slip_stitch repeat repeat * work instructions immediately following * then repeat as many times as directed round round dtr2tog work two dtr together this is a de- increase increase by dtr ch3 dtr in same crease pattern instructions short and long-sleeved top round 1 chain 90 or as many as needed to comfortably fit over your head and create the neckline you want care- fully slip_stitch to beg chain-1 without twisting fold neck band in half placing the beginning of the round yarn tail end in the centre of one of the longer sides count along 6 stitches from the fold and place sm in 6th stitch repeat this for the opposite edge of the neckband you should have 2 sm opposite each other repeat this for the other end of the neckline these 4 sm are where you will do the raglan increases for the yoke round 2 chain 6 sk2 dtr *ch2 sk2 dtr repeat from* until dtr before sm space ch2 dtr in the sm space chain 3 and dtr in same space move sm up repeat from * until end of round slip_stitch to 4th stitch of beg chain-6 round 3 repeat round 2 until yoke reaches your armpits for me uk 12/14 this was 8 times try on top and check fit do this regularly and see adjustments section below if you need to make any increase or decrease to get the fit you want round 4 as round 2 until **the last chain-2 dtr- before sm
